paper_abstract: The linear arboricity of a graph G is the minimum number of linear forests which partition the edges of G. Akiyama, Exoo and Harary conjectured that [Delta(G)/2] <= la(G) <= [Delta(G)+1/2] for any simple graph G. In the paper, it is proved that if G is a planar graph with Delta >= 7 and wi thout i -cycles for some i is an element of {4, 5}, then la(G) = [Delta(G)/2] (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The linear arboricity of planar graphs with no short cycles
